dataIdInfo.idPurp: This is a python toolbox used to create backups of a knowledge graph and create a new knowledge graph from those backups.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
There are two tools in this toolbox.

Backup Knowledge Graph as JSON

  • This tool downloads the data model, entities, relationships, provenance, and optionally the item details of a knowledge graph service. Outputs are stored in a folder as a collection of JSON files, and a PNG for the thumbnail.

  • This tool prompts the user to select a knowledge graph service from the active ArcGIS Pro portal connection.

  • The user then selects the location for the output

  • The output files are organized into a folder, named after the input knowledge graph service. This name can be changed.

  • The user can choose to also download the item details. This includes specifically: title, snippet (summary), description, tags, and thumbnail.

Create Knowledge Graph from JSON

  • This tool creates a new knowledge graph service from the the output of the Backup Knowledge Graph as JSON tool.

  • If the upload item details parameter box is checked, be aware that the title of the item will be updated to the title of the "backed up" knowledge graph service. Remember that items in a portal have a name, title, and ID. The name and ID are always different, but titles can be reused.

Both of these tools are based off of the code provided by this help documentation page: https://developers.arcgis.com/python/samples/create-and-load-knowledge-graph-backups/
